title: FCA on alert after US auto parts giant’s collapse exposes cracks in private credit - Yahoo Finance
summary:
The FCA described First Brands’ implosion, alongside the bankruptcy of subprime auto lender Tricolor, as “interesting case studies” in how unregulated private markets can amplify financial instability.
The BBC reported that private credit, sometimes called shadow banking, has ballooned since the 2008 financial crisis as traditional banks pulled back from lending.
While the FCA stressed that UK institutions appear insulated for now, the regulator acknowledged that cross-border exposure through global private credit funds warrants attention.
The private credit market’s reach, including European asset managers and insurers exposed through high-yield funds, could mean UK and EU financial systems are not fully immune.
